publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-960# Christine Grahame: Borders Textile Industry-That the Parliament, in recognising the economic plight of the Borders textiles industry, notes the continuing decline with the recent announcement of a further 290 jobs lost with the closure of Laidlaw and Fairgrieve Ltd; further notes the £100 million provided for the former Rover workers, and recommends that the Scottish Executive make immediate representations to Her Majesty's Government for substantial funding to support and develop this core industry. Supported by: Michael Russell*, Colin Campbell*, Mr John Swinney*
S1M-960# Borders Textile Industry (lodged on 6 June 2000) Shona Robison*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-960# Borders Textile Industry (lodged on 6 June 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Alex Neil*

Supported by: Michael Russell, Colin Campbell, Mr John Swinney, Shona Robison, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Dr Winnie Ewing, Alex Neil, Robin Harper*
S1M-960# Borders Textile Industry (lodged on 6 June 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Andrew Wilson*, Fergus Ewing*
